title: Sender blocking on thundernird mobile
content: Why can't we block senders on tb mobile as we can on desktop?
creator: jaydog

title: MS Edge and Thunderbird
content: links in Thunderbird open in MS Edge even though Google Chrome is my default browser...cannot find any setting to overcome this...recently refreshed windows 10 have looked everywhere....
creator: dougcarr

title: Thunderbird update
content:
The last update removed where I normally read my mail, I think it was called "preview pane". It normally takes the lower third of the screen. Any ideas on getting it back? Expanding mail to almost full screen just to see if you want to keep it seems counterproductive. It was working fine at Noon. It was about 5 PM PDT when I next went to Thunderbird, it updated and hasn't worked right since! [128.8.1esr (32 bit)]

allen.r.wheeler@imajis.com
creator: allen.r.wheeler

title: versione 136 thunderbird mozilla
content: ho installato ultima versione di mozilla thunderbird 136 io uso windows 11 e ora con la nuova versione di thunderbird 136 quando scarico i messaggi e clicco sopra un messaggio si pare la finestra con una dele opzioni che dice MODIFICACOME NUOVO MESSAGGIO questo non lo fa piu perchè e come posso rimediare

title: Using oauth2 with mailcow?
content:
mailcow just got keycloak oauth2 support. Does thunderbird work with keycloak oauth2?

https://mailcow.email/posts/2023/mailcow-idp/ - or is work maybe ongoing on that and there's a ticket I can track?
creator: kl13

title: Thunderbird does not show my own email address
content: I use Outlook on Thunderbird. If I log in to Outlook using a browser and send an email. Then I check the email in Thunderbird's Outbox, the sender is not my own email address, but a string of characters starting with "IMCEAEX-_O" If I send an email through Thunderbird, the sender can be displayed normally.

title: Thunderbird showing 78% full. My drive is also not full.
content: My thunderbird account showing 78% full even I have deleted many mails, from Deleted folder also. Out of 15 Gb, I have only used 2.2MB storage of google drive and my account is not a google account. Can someone please help me to fix this, Thank you

title: Thunderbird login
content: I changed my password on e-mail provider server. Mail works fine via browser, but i can't send and obtain any e-mails via Thunderbird. I have changed password but it doesn't work. Piotr
creator: piotrzwincentowa

title: Why is my junk mail folder in Thunderbird's trash?
content: I use an AOL email account and Thunderbird on my Mac. In Thunderbird, the junk mail folder - which AOL call "Bulk Mail" for some reason - has moved to the Trash folder and I can't get it out. It's a Thunderbird problem - if I go onto my account at AOL.com, everything is normal. How do I get it out? I've tried cutting and pasting it, creating a new folder...nothing seems to work. I don't want to empty the trash in case I no longer have a junk folder at all
creator: rogercorke

title: Calendar Invite Thund.>> Outlook
content:
Hi everyone, I use Thunderbird with the integrated calendar extension to invite people to meetings. Within Thunderbird, the message and invitation arrive just fine: you can read everything when the email arrives in the normal message area. However, when I send the invitation to clients using Outlook, they only see an empty email with the option to accept the invitation (or not). Once they accept, the email disappears from their inbox (which is probably a different problem). More importantly, when they open the appointment in their calendar, they have to click on an attachment before they see the description (i.e. the link to an online meeting).

It seems that the invitation sent by Thunderbird is not fully integrated.

Does anyone know how to fix this? Looking forward to your response,
creator: info12779

title: problema con schermata email
content: Buongiorno ho bisogno di assistenza per le email perchè non mi trovo comoda nella lettura ricezione invio......vi chiedo di contattarmi. Grazie

title: Calendar Events
content: As of a couple of days ago I cannot add new events to my calendar on Thunderbird email. I can enter events to edit them but the changes do not show and I cannot move events around either. I have checked and none of the calendars are read only. This is a shared calendar but the other user has no problems editing or adding events, although i cannot see the changes they make.
creator: rushenparishorg

title: Inviti ad evento
content: Ho aggiornato Thunderbird all'ultima versione disponibile. Quando ricevo un invito ad un evento non compare più la richiesta se accettarlo, e quindi non so come fare l'operazione. Grazie

title: Can not customize Thunderbird 128.8
content: I can not do any customization of Thunderbird 128.8. What am I missing or not doing? Have followed all the blogs and think i have installed all the updates but still nothing happens. I am stuck with the same old classic view as in previous versions. Any suggestions?

title: close all opened messages or start thunderbird without any tab . error was made selecting open hundreds of emails
content:
User instead of select messages and delete them , choosed to open all , so now thunderbird cannot work or start , with maybe hundreds of messages to open , thunderbird is using all pc memory and lock the computer

We need the command (if it exists) to start without any open tabs or maybe some keys to close all tabs
creator: jairszapiro

title: profile location on Ubuntu
content:
[The documentation](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_finding-your-profile-without-opening-thunderbird) says that my profile should be at `home/[user]/.thunderbird`. It is not there.

In settings the "Open Directory" button does nothing (cursor spins and then nothing happens).

In `about:profiles` I see the profile listed at `/home/[user]/.thunderbird/[XXX]`. That folder does not exist (so far as I can tell (I have hidden files turned on). The _Local Directory_ version _does_ exist (`/home/[user]/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/cache/thunderbird/[XXX]`)

What's going on? Am I doing something wrong?

title: Understanding syncing of the address book with Google Contacts
content:
I installed Thunderbird 136.0.1 for Windows this week to use with my Gmail/Google account. I'm loving the way it works and the fact that it interfaces with the Google calendars (even the birthday calendar driven by Google contacts) well. The address book seems a bit more inconsistent with syncing/updating and I'm trying to gain an understanding of how that works. If I add a contact the the address book in Thunderbird, it shows up in the web interface in Google contacts. However, If I delete a contact in the web interface, that contact is not removed from the Thunderbird address book. Am I just not being patient enough for the syncing to take place?

Thanks! Rob

title: Can't launch Thunderbird on one Mac user account - different behavior
content:
I previously posted [launch Thunderbird on one Mac user account] and the solution by @DavidGG worked then. But it isn't working this time. So I really need to know what file triggers the Thunderbird Install Helper dialog on macOS.

Here are the steps for the current situation:

Steps: 1. On user 2, launch Thunderbird. 2. Get the dialog that there's an update to 128.8.0esr. 3. Click the Restart to update button. 4. Get the dialog that there's an update to 128.8.0esr. 5. Click the Restart to update button. 6. Get the dialog to enter admin ID and password for installing the Thunderbird helper. 7. Enter the admin ID and password and click OK.

Expected result: Thunderbird relaunches, now with 128.8.1esr. Actual result: Get the dialog to enter admin ID and password for installing the Thunderbird helper.

10. Log off user 2 and log on to user 1.

Here is where I did something different from the previous issue. Last time I deleted Thunderbird and re-installed it. This time I did the upgrade.

11. On user 1, launch Thunderbird. 12. Get the dialog that there's an update to 128.8.0esr. 13. Click the Restart to update button. 14. Get the dialog that there's an update to 128.8.0esr. 15. Click the Restart to update button. 16. Get the dialog to enter admin ID and password for installing the Thunderbird helper. 17. Enter the admin ID and password and click OK.

Expected and actual result: Thunderbird launches and I can use it normally.

18. Log out of user 1 and log into user 2. 19. Launch Thunderbird

Expected result: Thunderbird launches and I can use it normally. Actual result: Get the dialog to enter admin ID and password for installing the Thunderbird helper.

I'm guessing there's some manner of residual file that's preventing Thunderbird from launching on user 2. I've verified Thunderbird is in the system's Application folder and not in user 1's files.

So I continued with the recommended remediation from the previous issue:

20. Trash ~/Library/Thunderbird 21. Launch Thunderbird

Expected result: Thunderbird launches and I can proceed recover profiles.ini and the Profiles folder from the trash Actual result: Get the dialog to enter admin ID and password for installing the Thunderbird helper.

How do I clear the pending install from user 2 so that Thunderbird will launch for user 2? What is the specific file or code line that triggers the request to install the helper?

(Yes, I did move my files back out of the trash so I don't lose them. I also have a TimeMachine backup.)

I suppose I could totally re-install Thunderbird like I did the other time, but I'm hoping for a less time-intensive solution. I guess I could also dust off my old programming skills and dive into the source code - an advantage of Open Source - but it's not a strength for me and Thunderbird is coded in a language I'm not fluent in.
creator: cbelov

title: Thunderbird will not let me reply to email.
content: Thunderbird will not let me reply to email. I try to reply and I get this box: "ESMTP not available" (whatever that means). Over the years I have been using and donating to this service but this keeps dysfunction keeps happening. I am frustrated and a bit angry. It doesn't seem appropriate. I do not know how to fix it. It is not my job to know how to fix it. I am an artist and a writer. I do my job. I am not a tech person. - JohnB

title: Thunderbird 115.x - Can't Delete Messages
content:
Running Thunderbird 115.10.x on Windows 10 Pro 22H2 on an older Samsung Note 9 Pro 15 w/ an 8th gen Intel i7, 16GB RAM and an aftermarket 1TB SSD w/ over 660GB of free space. I have emails going back to 1997 in the Sent folder (16K sent emails). While running Thunderbird 115.9.x earlier today, I noticed I suddenly could not delete emails out of my Inbox. The following error message was displayed:

The messages could not be moved or copied to folder 'Trash on [username@domain.com]' because writing to folder failed. To gain disk space, from the File menu, first choose Empty Trash, and then choose Compact Folders, and then try again.

So I did that to no avail. I then tried to delete messages out of other folders as a test (Sent, Drafts, etc.) figuring I could simply move them back if successful. Received the same error message. Closed all applications and rebooted the laptop as it had been running for several days. Same error message.

Did some research which all told me to delete the Trash MBOX files (including the .msf file). Did that, same result. Launched in Safe Mode, same result. Created a Trash.txt file, removed the .txt file extension and relaunched Thunderbird. Same result. Compacted all folders and relaunched. Same result.

If I backup the current folders and restore from them, I'll get the same result. Anyone have a new idea or set of instructions I can follow?

Thanks!
creator: dunogod
